Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern rooms at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Kaitlyn M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the AC sants in Barcelona for 3 nights. The hotel is situated right beside the Sants station - the main train station in Barcelona. Although there isn't much around the area it is easy to use the metro lines as they all run through that station as well as the hop on hop off tour bus (which stops 500 meters away). There is free wifi in the lobby and bar area which is great as their bar area also has a tv and a area for free soda, water and espresso in the afternoon and night. The rooms are very modern and sleek looking. The mini bar is free which was awesome! It has fantas, coke, water and tonic water. The only downside is the washroom set up is a bit odd because there is no separation between the bed and the washroom and shower area. There is only a shower and no bathtub. The shower is a bit tinted but this would be awkward if you were traveling with a friend etc.. You would probably have to leave the room or stare out the window while the other washes up. Other than that I don't have any complaints. The shower is wonderful, with the perfect amount of pressure! The only issue is there is nothing going on around the area at night so you have to commute about 10 minutes to get to tw main drag. But at the rate and the quality of the hotel I didn't mind!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, free mini bar,”
Reviews.Author: SharonCH
Reviews.Content: The location is quit good, right at the back of train station Sants, 5 minutes to metro. room is quiet enough. Mini bar with soft drinks is free of charge. Afternoon complimentary coffee in the lobby. Free wifi in lobby too. Cold breakfast buffet for 17 Euro is not cheap. Front desk personnel is not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay prior to NCL Cruise”
Reviews.Author: jwuleo
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel with all needed amenities and a very helpful staff. It's also about 2 blolcks from a large metro stop and one block from a major shopping center. They do serve a buffet type breakfast but no meals the rest of the day, there are many restuarants at the nearby mall. There is free wi-fi in the lobby if you bring your own laptop, if you use the hotel computer the wi-fi is still free but there is a service fee for using their computer. Most importantly I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lynsey189
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location. Only a 20 minute ride on the RENFE train from the airport and only a 2 minute walk from the train station. Close to metro stations for easy access into Las Ramblas and other attractions. Very modern decor and a mini fridge that was filled with complimentary soft drinks on a daily basis. The best part of the room was the power shower!The doors close very loudly if you dont pull them closed behind you. Being a light sleeper I was woken up a couple of times through the night by this but in the whole not a great problem. Our room was on the front of the hotel overloooking the station but did not find it noisy at all. The staff were welcoming and helpful and provided us with a map and marked the location of the hotel on it for us. We didnt stay at the hotel for breakfast but plenty of small cafes around to go to. Overall a great hotel to stay if you don't want to be right in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “What an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Emma D
Reviews.Content: I really didn't want to go back to Barcelona after my first trip there but my partner was dying to go to a Barcelona FC game so we did. I had horrible accommodation when I'd previously been there and I think that was largely why I didn't enjoy myself, because this time was wonderful. The hotel was a 3 minute walk from the train station which was perfect since we got a train into Barcelona from Valencia and also left by train. The hotel was modern and clean with exceptionally friendly hotel staff who gave us a map and marked on places we wanted to go. Our mini bar was full of complimentary drinks which was a lovely touch and the bathroom was great with an actual shower (not the dreaded bath and shower all in one) and there was free wi-fi in reception. For what we paid for this hotel it really was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Anthony_Chien
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the Christmas period in 2011. Excellent hotel at excellent location. Very convenient and personal safe in room. Very near subway stations and train stations. Stayed the full 11-days in Barcelona. Strongly recommended visitors to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staffs are the best”
Reviews.Author: Reza S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is reasonably price and closed to Metro Station - you can not ask for better and friendlier staff than this hotel. We spent 4 nights there and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Position Perfect”
Reviews.Author: NARRAAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel Oct 11 arrived by train,( from Paris ) which is a 3 minute walk from Sants station.The "RED" tour bus is only a 2 minute walk.Around the corner you have a store that sells cheap wine and Alcohol. We found a great place to eat not 5 minutes away,they had main meals and Tapas,great service and cheap.The Hotel was Brilliant,yes, maybe they could have spoken English a bit better,but you are in their Country !!! We are already booked to stay in this Hotel in Nov 2012, as we will be going back to the States on a Transatlantic Cruise,the cruise Terminal is only a 10 Euro Taxi Fare from the Hotel.You don't have to worry about pickpockets here, and you are only a 10 minute train ride to the centre of Barcelona............

Reviews.Title: “Great for weekend in City”
Reviews.Author: BAManEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Cant fault it. Very clean rooms, great showers, everything you need for a city break but not rip off prices. Marriott Gold not eligible for free breakfast which seems wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, convenient location, good value”
Reviews.Author: GourmetTravel888
Reviews.Content: Sleek, modern, minimalist rooms with some interesting design elements. Open bathroom concept. Enclosed shower. Separate enclosed toilet, dark colours, felt a bit claustrophobic. No fan. Very clean, and the housekeeping staff were fantastic. Overall, a great value, great experience. Room can be a bit noisy, depending on what is going on outside, especially on the weekends. Friendly helpful staff. Free WiFi in lobby/lounge area. Location was very convenient, close to Metro. Abundance of taxis just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with decent location”
Reviews.Author: Bk1717
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a modern setting and is very nice. The staff is friendly and very helpful with any questions. They have a free minibar which is nice and the location is close the the metro which allows for easy traveling around the city. The price on wifi is good and the shower is very nice. The only issue was that the hotel is right at the train station which creates a lot of noise with cars throughout the night which makes it somewhat difficult to sleep at times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: RTOKU
Reviews.Content: Perfect quiet location with lots of local places to eat within walking distance. Room was spacious and great shower. Brian at the front desk translated "sinus infection" into Spanish so we could tell the pharmacy what we were suffering from. There are two metro stations within a five minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great locaation!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth M
Reviews.Content: We had visited Barcelona before. We wanted to avoid the rip off mentality of Les Ramblas, so, we stayed further out of town, right next door to the Sants staion. The hotel is nice, if a little hot. Complimentary non alcoholic drinks in the room and the bar is a nice touch. You have to help yourself to soft drinks/coffee in the bar. The bar does not really cater for alcohlic drinks but there are plenty of bars outside the hotel and well within walking distance. In Les Ramblas it was €11 for 2 drinks, in Sants it was €5 for 2, no contest. I would advise getting the train into town, there is an informaton booth in the station, but for the 2 of us it cost €8 and we could take 5 trips each, a taxi back at night was €8. The tapas bars around Sants were quaint and friendly, and we dont speak any Spanish. The hotel staff were friendly. I would recommend this hotel and area.

Reviews.Title: “AC Sants by Marriott Hotel, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Angela H
Reviews.Content: What a lovely room, quite modern in layout, fabulous shower, free drinks from the fridge (when booked online) free safe, hairdryer fabulous (always take my own but never used it once as the one supplied was actually better), great location near Montjuic area, Barcelona Olympic Stadium and Spanish Village, handy for tour buses (good to get perspective of where everything is) if getting Barcelona card from the airport - make sure you have been given it in English as the lady gave us both the booklet in Spanish/French not handy at all considering she knew we were English!!!! Thanks for that not! Tour bus is a really good idea instead of the Barcelona card as you get a booklet with loads of discounts vouchers which actually work out better than the discounts in the Barcelona Card booklet the advantage of the Barcelona card is you can travel free on the trains and metro but its cheap anyway to travel, also the card is activated once you use it on the metro. Bite the bullet when getting the metro its actually quite easy to use just make sure you are going the right way, we had no problems. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cvcook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night after flying into Barcelona and before catching a train to France. It's very easy to get to from the airport using the RENFE train; walk out of the Barcelona Sants station and there it is, an easy walk. The location made catching the train to France the next morning very easy too. Not only close to the Sants metro but also to another metro stop. Our room wasn't ready, as we expected, and we stowed our bags with the front desk. Staff was very helpful when we asked for directions, a map, etc. The room was small-ish but very well designed. No carpet which was a surprise at first but I came to love because it felt cleaner. We had no trouble with noise but then there wasn't any celebration going on in the neighborhood. Free mini-bar was great. Our only complaint is that the A/C didn't work as well as we would have liked. We set it as high (low temp) as it could go but it still didn't cool down enough. We didn't ask the front desk about it because we were very tired so sleep came pretty easily and we we spending only one night.

Reviews.Title: “barcelona stopovers”
Reviews.Author: billlatimer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights prior to joining our cruise ship and for 1 night after the cruise. The hotel is ideally situated behind Sants main railway station where taxis are plentiful and the airport is only 20 minutes away by train.The hotel is modern and tastefully decorated and the rooms are very clean, comfortable and well equipped. The buffet breakfast was excellent and the dining room was really nice. There are plenty shops, bars and restaurants within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Sants station, though a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: TezzMezz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short 2-3 minute walk to Sants station which is excellent. Getting anywhere is so easy because of this. There is also a stop for the "Bus Turistik" not far from the hotel. However, if it's raining, you'll get wet walking to the station as there's no covered walkpath. I arrived around 11am on a Thursday and was glad to be given a room straight away, as I had just gotten off a 15 hour flight. Room was very clean, though the hallways are a bit dark and musky. The shower recess is interesting as mentioned by several reviews below and while great for a loving couple, not exactly appropriate for, say, two colleagues sharing a room. I was alone, so not a problem. The free mini bar was well appreciated as it's very hot in Barcelona in August. The bar on the lobby also offers free drinks and some munchies, which is great while using the free WiFI internet at the lobby. The neighborhood seem to be in some sort of party mode while I was there. There were concerts and live street bands all over the place. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and joining in the fun but when it came time for bed, I had to use earplugs (which I normally carry when I travel as I'm a light sleeper). These guys were partying on the street till 3am! On a weekday! Hahah... really fun to see people enjoying themselves so much. The staff at the hotel are nothing special. They're ok, just doing their jobs. Don't expect fantastic personalised service. I would probably say that the best thing going for this hotel is the location as I only used the hotel to wash up and sleep. But as a place to rest and recharge, AC Sants is pretty good. Clean, comfortable, safe. I didn't need anything more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and right by fantastic transport links”
Reviews.Author: hcgrainger
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for our anniversary last April and we found that the location (although not much in the immediate area) was fantastic for hopping on the metro to anywhere. The metro system in Barcelona is superb so for us this was a great option. The hotel itself was clean, smart and our room had a fully stocked mini bar, along with very comfortable bed and great bath/shower. The only negative was when my partner had to go to a business meeting I popped out to buy some lunch and came back to the cleaners in my room - not a problem normally but they insisted I went away until they had finished so I found myself shut out of our hotel room for another 10 minutes! We didn't eat here, so I can't comment on that, but regardless of the cleaning service issue we enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away. Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: khaa1329
Reviews.Content: I was taken away by my wife for my birthday, we have stayed in many AC hotels before, the brand has been great. However AC Sants lets the brand down. The room we checked into was dirty initially with broken furniture, the staff struggled with English. We had a nightmare with no running water on my birthday, the staff could not handle this situation professionally, I had to go without a wash on my birthday! We asked for the manager and were told no one was around to speak to me. The customer service for Marriott and the hotel manager have been awful after we complained. Shame as this has tarnished the AC brand. Much nicer hotels in Barcelona for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, heat and half used bottle in minibar! 4 star!?”
Reviews.Author: chucke1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a night on our way home, a 22 hour journey. It was a Wednesday night and we checked in at out 8.30pm. We were put in a room on the 4th floor on the corner facing the Sants Railway station. Went to the free minibar for a drink and found an opened bottle a third empty! The noise from the discos below was unbearable! I've been to quieter rock concerts. When we got into our room the temp was 28 deg C, and we put the AC on and went to dinner (used a cc card to stop power going off when we left). 3 hours later still 25 deg C and the noise still blaring! Went to front office and asked for another room. Only room still on the noisy side and hot as hell. AC Hotel Sants by Marriott? I'm a Marriott's rewards member, but Hotel only has slight affiliation with Marriott so no free internet for me (or points). Front Office clerk took pity and gave me free internet access (after all had to do something - couldn't sleep!) Oh ...... room was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Handily Situated”
Reviews.Author: southwestscorer
Reviews.Content: Helpful and friendly staff, the room I had was a good size and was well equipped. The free soft drinks was a nice touch. Did not have breakfast here as there are plenty of bars around. The air conditioning worked well and the shower was good and powerful. It is not the most centrally located but as Barcelona city centre seems to shut a lot earlier than it used too it is very handy for the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jianyu
Reviews.Content: it is the hotel with good location (train and metro), helpful staff. The breakfast is ok (typical European breakfast). Positive is that all soft drinks are free and will be re-filled every day.

Reviews.Title: “Short and sweet”
Reviews.Author: IrelandElle_42
Reviews.Content: We were only in Barcelona for one night, and primarily chose the hotel for it's proximity to the train station. It's literally a stones throw, which was perfect as we had an early train to catch. It also makes getting around the city really easy, as the metro operates from there too. The hotel was very nice - clean, modern. The room was well equipped, with all the usual toiletries and some nice extras, free mini bar (soft drinks), and comfy bed. The bathroom set up is unusual, as it's not a separate room as such, with the shower essentially part of the main room, divided by a sliding wall. Different, and only really suitable for couples of solo travellers! The one fault I would have with this hotel was the breakfast. While there was a fairly wide selection of pastries, cheese, meats, etc on offer, there's no way that it was worth almost 17euro per person!! Complete rip off, and certainly wouldn't spring for that again. Also, there were ants on our table...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but remember to bring your earplugs.”
Reviews.Author: yuppietravels
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and lived up to its rating. It is right next to the train station, so that could be very convenient if your traveling by train. It is not particularly close to anything else with a ‘tourist’ interest, but the metro is very easy to navigate and the stop is right there in the train station. The windows seemed ‘thin’ and an awful lot of street noise can be heard, as well as people chatting and singing (and it was a sunday night that we stayed there). A pair of ear plugs would have remedied this and I so wish I had brought some with me. They don’t have any at the front desk, as I checked on the odd chance that they did. The street noise is my only complaint about this hotel. It was clean, comfortable, modern. It has a little cafe/bar in the lobby and a free minibar (with a few soda’s, and water). The staff was friendly and helpful. I would absolutely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location right next to train station”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler012
Reviews.Content: I had an early train out of Barcelona so needed to be close to the station. This was about as close as one could get--just a few steps across the plaza. The hotel was nice, ultramodern, a bit stark and cubist (not cozy!) in the room's design. It fit our needs well though I preferred spending the earlier part of our Barcelona visit in an AirB&B flat. We had a car when we first arrived and finding the parking garage was a bit confusing--it is around to the left, down a ramp and underneath--it's necessary to ring a buzzer to get the attendant to open the garage door to allow you inside. My husband flew out the next morning and had been led to believe that the RENFE line from Sants to the Airport was the most direct and efficient. However, he almost missed his plane because when he got off at the airport stop it was then necessary to wait for and take a bus to the Airport. We had assumed that the metro stop at the airport would be accessible to the terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: hwt61
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to Barcelona Ave train station. However, the hotel is not in the vicinity from La Rambla area though it is easily reachable via subway. There are couple of restaurants near by. The hotel itself is clean, free internet is only available in the lobby. Breakfast is not included but easily available in the various cafe in the train station. There is a hop on hop off stop near the hotel. If you do not mind taking subway to LaRambla, then this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: nexstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AC Sants for a week for our trip at Barcelona. Overall, the hotel is good and we can't ask for more. There is a free mini bar in the roomwith water and pop. comfortable bed and clean modern room. They also have a free bar and snack in the late afternoon and after 12:00am in the lobby for guest to use. One thing I should let you know is that the shower in the rooms is open concept - the shower room glass is only lightly tinted and can be seen thought, so if you are going to share a room with someone that you don't know well and you don't want to see them showering, you should not consider the standard room. Also, the cleaning lady starts cleaning the room around 10:00am and you do hear the noise from the hallway and next door. Both of the above was not a problem for us as we left the room early and we are a couple. I recommend this hotel for anyone and I will stay there again if I am back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great all over.”
Reviews.Author: Norcopian
Reviews.Content: Our stay at AC Sants was all good. The room was all we could ask for and more. Some reviewers say that you hear the cleaningladies to well as they do their job. My advise, don't be in your room then :), get up early and get on with your stay in one of the most wonderful cities in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “AC SANTS BARCELONA,WORTH STAY THERE”
Reviews.Author: Alkees_11
Reviews.Content: The best hotel i've ever stayed.Everyone was so friendly,great location,great room,clean fast wi fi connection!!!a small treasure in Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Pleasant Service, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: Arkybergy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located across the street from the main train terminal which provides easy access for cabs and metro. The neighborhood is very nice with a 7-screen cinema, cafe's, bars and restaurants. The reception staff was tremendously friendly and helpful, assisting with restaurant reservations and directions. Entry into the hotel or exit from the elevators were always met with a smile and a sincere "hola". The room was very comfortable. There were only a few drawbacks --- the HVAC system. We were there in March when the weather started to get warm. Unfortunately, the HVAC only has two settings for the entire hotel -- Winter/Summer. Therefore, despite the warmer weather, the thermostat could never go below 25 C because it was winter mode. While that would not normally be a problem as we love the fresh air of open windows, the proximity to the local park made this impossible. The noise from the park was so loud, we felt there had to be some acoustic phenomena to explain the high decibel level. As a result, we either got too toasty or too much noise. The other bad feature is the shower stall design. Whenever either of us took a shower, the floor was drenched.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, Fantastic, I cant find enough words to descripe this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: granny40
Reviews.Content: Great location, Friendly and efficiant staff, The room was fab, so clean, and a brilliant view. I travelled with my Husband whom I had brought to see a football match at FCBarcelona for his 60th Birthday. We have been several times before as we travel to Barcelona every year for the Merce festival in September, we have stayed in a number of different hotels , but the AC Sants is by far the best Hotel that we have ever stayed in. It is just a stonesthrow away from Sants station which has connections to the Airport and the city.I could not fault a single thing about this hotel. Congratulations to management and staff for more than 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect positioning”
Reviews.Author: MikeFH
Reviews.Content: A mere 100m from the main Sants station with easy and swift access via the excellent Metro to all parts of Barcelona. Also on the tourist bus route and on a direct line to the airport. A modern, comfortable hotel with large well-equipped rooms. As usual in continental hotels tea and coffee making facilities were absent, but there was a fridge, with free soft drinks. Pleasant, helpful reception staff. A far better choice than staying in the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: FromHungary
Reviews.Content: Hi there visitors! Two words: cool hotel! :) I choosed this hotel from these reviews, thanks! The hotel location is great, there is the main railway station, so if you want to trip with the AVE /fast/ train to Madrid (which highly recommended), then this hotel is the best choice! There are a metro station in the near, and also the Bus Turistic stop is near too! The check-in was fast, breakfast was rich and good, various style of food, also included traditional spanish style food! The bed was large, the free minibar is a great idea. It was quiet in the night, so we slept well! I think the "AC" brand is a good brand. I think I would choose from AC if i will travel to Spain again. Internet is not free, that's a big con! :( We stayed 3 nights, everything was outstanding, worth the price. At the check-out they told us that we have a few euros bill because some wine or beer consumption, but we don't. Perhaps somebody told our room number. :) So we left.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad but ...”
Reviews.Author: mifried134
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights when we went to Barcelona for the first time. We had booked well in advance to get the special tariff - 15 per cent off. The booking process was as easy as could be. A week before our arrival we got a welcoming email promising the nice 1.8 by 2 metre bed and the free minibar. Sounded nice. When we arrived the checkin process was fast and so we arrived to see our room which was clean and furnished in a modern style. Black glass dominates the bathroom section. However, while laying ourselves to rest we started to doubt that the bed really was 1.8m wide. In fact, it was just 1.4m which meant that we had been given a single room. Well, we didn't complain because we really just spent the nights there but having had a glimpse at the "normal" rooms we were - understandably - a bit jealous. Well, next time I would complain because I find it quite cheeky that people who book the discount rates get lower quality rooms. If this is company policy then I'd rather stay away from AC hotels. The wifi internet access is provided via a prepaid card which can be obtained at the reception. The good thing about it is that you get access for 24 hrs - as in our case - for three days. If you don't access the net you wouldn't get charged. The free minibar is stocked up everyday and provides you with pops and water. Best part of our stay ...

Reviews.Title: “Truly 1-der-ful. Fab!!”
Reviews.Author: Idly_Saambar
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel , next to sants estacio station ( 30 yards from the west entrance). Very good service, plush rooms with good climate control systems. Me and Mrs went to do conference presentation at the Global Conference on Maternal and Infant Health at Palau de Congressos. No coffee machine in my room, but you can request as many coffees/teas/water from the reception. Its free. Minibar has beverages but no alcohol. I didn't use it anyway as I was busy preparing this presentation and then went off for sightseeing. Lots of eateries / bars outside hotel , open till late and public transport ( trains/metro) run till 2 am. Food is expensive. I didn't have any alcohol during this trip, so don't know the costs. 1 GBP was 1.07 Euros so watch where you eat/drink. Hotel staff spoke/understood English ( Thank you my dear Lord), and there was one Mr Javier, nice guy very helpful. On request, you will get EU plug adaptors, in case you forgot to pack them. You have return it on checkout or else get billed. We also got discounted city hopper sightseeing tour tickets , from this hotel. We payed 32 euros and saved 8 euros. All in all, a good comfortable hotel, really nice. Shower has a sliding glass door , forget about privacy. Anyway I am and have been married for 11 years. Who gives a bull.. The loo is separate and doored without a lock. This is part 3 of my barcelona trip. Will continue in next. If interested, look into part 1 and 2 of my trip, which are separate posts. Gracias !!!!

Reviews.Title: “A bad start to a special celebration and holiday”
Reviews.Author: MaggieKent_10
Reviews.Content: On the 17th September we arrived in Barcelona to connect with the beginning of our cruise the following day. After dining out we were drenched in ta downpour as we returned to the hotel. We decided to change out of our soaking wet clothes and go down to the Bar for a warming cup of coffee and brandy. This is when your reputation fell apart. We had to ask Reception TWICE if there was anyone on duty to take our order, but it was nearly an hour before our order was taken and delivered without any apology, regret, or even eye-contact. The charge of TWENTY TWO euros for 2 coffees and 2 brandies is somewhat exhorbitant anyway , but under these circumstances was just totally unacceptable. Because this was the start of a long awaited very special occasion we did not wish to end a long and tiring day with a slanging match with your staff - who were well aware of our discomfort (or, SHOULD have been), but chose to conveniently ignore this situation. Perhaps you could consider sending your staff on a training course with Pullmantur Cruises for them to discover what quality service, given by smiling, friendly staff can do for your customers - and for your reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Modern stylish good value digs at Barcelona Sants Station”
Reviews.Author: YeVoyage
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night on the AVE from Madrid and departing early next morning from the Barcelona Airport. This is a good choice if in need of accommodation for the night whilst in transit. Stylish, very efficiently designed rooms -- think W but with better layout -- very sexy shower stalls in black with smoked glass doors. Could not avail of the breakfast but service was accommodating of a room switch as an outdoor street festival was roaring late at night. Drawback -- no availability of a steam iron/ironing board (even on request).

Reviews.Title: “Although 5/6 stops from the Ramblas area...”
Reviews.Author: Postcardsfromtheedge
Reviews.Content: Although 5/6 stops from the Ramblas area, it was nice hotel and was perfect as a base to enjoy Barca

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great transport links”
Reviews.Author: LincolnLadyLincoln
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short break in August, 3 nights. Overall very good, modern and clean hotel which is great for getting trains, metro or the tourist bus, all can be done just outside the hotel at the Sants station. There is a free minibar, but only soft drinks, they were replenished daily though and linen changed daily. The included breakfast was a buffet style of cold meats, cheeses yogurt and pastries and cereal which was a bit same-y after 3 sessions. No cooked breakfast though which was a bit of a disapointment. It is obviously aimed at business users but we found it comfortable enough, If sharing, the smoked glass shower screen in the room though would make in unsuitable for anything other than very good friends!! Staff were friendly and some spoke English which is s bit of a bonus in Spain!! There are a few bars/restaurants just up the street that serve reasonably priced tapas and pizzas, the drinks though are expensive, check the price first. the 'Bar Gris' charges 7 euros for a cocktail!!

Reviews.Title: “nice room but design prevaled over usability”
Reviews.Author: Jos4f
Reviews.Content: - seeing yourself in the mirror while sitting on the toilet is not to everybody's liking, - a little stool in the bathroom area would have come in handy as ther are no hooks to hang your towel within reach of the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value :-)”
Reviews.Author: fussysleeperUk
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Yes - masculine decor, yes - hurried finishing means there are chipped bits here and there, yes - the rooms arent exactly spacious - but the pluses are huge. Very good for the station but NOT noisy - in fact the quietest hotel I may have ever stayed in. Very safe area. Wasnt busy at all (I stayed wed-fri nights) - and I was told it's primarily a business hotel so at its busiest during the week! Cheap, good value. Free soft drink minibar :-). Excellent value - not sure you can find much better without spending a fortune. Also some good bars nearby if you want to go exploring.

Reviews.Title: “A great base - very comfortable and quiet, despite excellent position near the main Sants rail station.”
Reviews.Author: JRDW
Reviews.Content: The new AC Sants hotel is a great base from which to explore the city. It is no more than 2 minutes walk from the main Sants railway station (c.20 minutes direct train to the airport), as well as being well positioned for the Metro, city tourist bus route and local shops and cafes. The hotel is quiet and nicely decorated (albeit monochrome); rooms are a decent size with large beds, a good shower and free wifi, although we found the temperature a little warm(in January!). The breakfast is underwhelming for the price. We'd recommend booking room only and visiting the various local bakeries or tapas bars (turn left out of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended if you sharing room with colleagues”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Marc
Reviews.Content: An average first class hotel. Stylish and clean. High design factor. When we stayed there we had booked a twin room, but at arrival we found out that they didn´t have any twin rooms... at all! - A hotel with only double beds. They were also fully booked so we could not split up in to two rooms. So my colleague and I had to share a double bed, but I guess that is ok. The worst was the outlay of the rooms. The only thing seperating the shower and the room was a glass door so there was no way of beeing in the room without see or bee seen in the shower.
